      How do I?

      • Find branch hours: Find a location and hours.
      • Update my address or other contact information: Log in to Online Banking, and choose “Self Service” from the customer service menu.
      • Enroll in Online /splash/quicken.html Banking: Enroll now.
      • Set up or change account Alerts: Log in to Online Banking, and choose my alerts from the customer service menu.
      • Retrieve my user ID: Get login assistance.
      • Reset my password: Get login assistance.
      • View, print or save online statements: Log in to Online Banking, and choose online statements on the left menu.
      • Find information about accessibility.
      • Learn more about the new rule for remittance transfers.
      • Notify the bank of the passing of a customer

      Appointment Scheduling

      You can schedule an appointment to meet with a banker by phone or in person for all branch services.

      The U.S. Bank Help Center has additional information on scheduling branch appointments, including:

      • What you should bring to your appointment
      • How much time to allow for your appointment
      • What to do when arriving for your appointment
      • How to cancel or reschedule an appointment

      How do I?

      Set up my card

      • Check the Status of My Credit Card Application? Please call 800-947-1444 and choose option 1 for the status of an application. The potential cardmember will be required to enter his/her social security number to locate the application. Additional verification item(s) will be needed to validate.
      • Complete My Saved Application
      • Activate My Credit Card: Follow instructions that come with your card or call the appropriate Cardmember Service number to the right.

      Update my card

      • Change the PIN: Please contact the appropriate Cardmember Service number to the right.
      • Card Number and Expiration Change Checklist

      Manage my card

      After logging in to your account you can

      • Make a Payment: Under Transfers & Payments, select Pay a U.S. Bank Account.
      • Set Up Account Alerts: Under Customer Service, select My Alerts.
      • Sign Up for Paperless Statements: Under My Documents, select Statement Preferences.
      • View or Redeem Rewards Earned: Under My Account, select My Rewards.
      • Download Transaction Data: From your Credit Card page, select Download Transactions at the top of the Account Activity table.
      • Request a Credit Limit Increase: Under Customer Service, select Self Service and then select Manage Your Credit Account.
      • Request a Balance Transfer: From your Credit Card page, select Request a Balance Transfer.
      • Dispute a Charge: From your Credit Card page, select Dispute a Charge under Take Action.
      • Add a Joint Owner: Under Customer Service, select Self Service and then select Manage Your Credit Account.
      • Add an Authorized Signer: Under Customer Service, select Self Service and then select Manage Your Credit Account.

      Online Security for my card

      • We provide the highest levels of security, encryption, and firewalls. Our Digital Security Guarantee covers any losses if there is any unauthorized use of your accounts while using U.S. Bank’s online or mobile banking. Learn more about our Online Banking Security.

      Report Lost or Stolen Cards/Accounts

      • Report Lost or Stolen Debit Cards or ATM Cards: Please Call 800-872-2657.
      • Report Lost or Stolen Credit Cards: Please Call 800-285-.8585.
      • Report Lost or Stolen Credit-Line Cards or Checks: Please Call 888-852-5786.
      • Lost/Stolen Checklist

      Speak to someone about a Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (SCRA) Request

      • The U.S. Bank Military Service Center is staffed with bankers familiar with the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (SCRA).
      • The Military Service Center can be reached at 800-934-9555 and is open Monday through Friday from 7 a.m. to midnight ET. If overseas, you can contact the Military Service Center using the international collect call number 513-277-5899.
      • Learn more about Military Banking.

      U.S. BANK GOLD CHECKING PACKAGE

      An account with extra benefits for U.S. Bank credit card or loan customers.

      Apply now

      Gold Checking Package details

      Monthly maintenance fee

      $0 or $14.95

      How to waive the monthly maintenance fee

      Your monthly maintenance fee can be waived if you have one of the following: an open U.S. Bank personal loan, line, mortgage or credit card.1

      Apply now

      Ready to get started?

      • Apply now
      • Call 800-239-3302
      • Make an appointment
      • Chat with a banker

      Gold Checking Package benefits

      ATM Transactions

      Pay no ATM Transaction fees at U.S. Bank ATMs. No ATM Transaction fees are charged on your first two Non-U.S. Bank ATM Transactions per statement period.2 (Note: Non-U.S. Bank ATM Transaction fees apply after two.)

      Overdraft protection transfers

      Pay no fees for overdraft protection transfers made from a linked deposit account (U.S. Bank consumer savings account, money market or a secondary checking account). Reduced fees for Overdraft Protection Transfer Fees when transfers are made from a linked U.S. Bank credit account 3 (Reserve Line of Credit, Credit Card, Personal Line of Credit, Home Equity Line of Credit and other lines of Credit).

      Basic banking must-haves

      Enjoy a U.S. Bank Visa® Debit Card, online and mobile banking with mobile check deposit,4 bill pay and more.

      Family member accounts

      Get up to two additional Easy Checking accounts with no monthly maintenance fee.5

      Benefits beyond checking

      A great savings account

      Competitive interest rates and no monthly maintenance fees are two big benefits of our Package Money Market Savings account,6 available to our Gold Checking Package customers. And like most U.S. Bank savings accounts, it can also be used to provide overdraft protection.

      Eligibility to save on closing costs

      Take 0.25% of your new first mortgage loan amount and deduct it from the closing costs, up to a maximum of $1,000.7 You may be eligible for this Customer Credit with a U.S. Bank personal checking package, or with an existing first mortgage with U.S. Bank.8

      100 free trades

      Get 100 free trades9 per calendar year with a self-directed brokerage account through our affiliate, U.S. Bancorp Investments.* Offer applies to online trades of equities and exchange-traded funds only and requires enrollment in paperless documents for self-directed brokerage account. Learn about brokerage and IRA accounts.

      For more information on features and pricing, check out:

      • Gold Checking Simple Snapshot
      • Consumer Pricing Information
      • Your Deposit Account Agreement

      Our online application process is fast and secure.

      You can open a checking account online in minutes with confidence. We use the strongest available 128-bit encryption to protect any information you send.

      Apply now

      1. Gold Monthly Maintenance Fee waiver  – Qualifying accounts include U.S. Bank Personal Line of Credit, home mortgages, home equity loans and lines of credit, personal and purpose loans and activated credit cards. (U.S. Bank Reserve Line of Credit and student loans are excluded.) Mortgage and credit products are subject to eligibility requirements and normal credit approval and may be subject to additional charges such as annual fees. Please refer to the credit agreement for full details.

        Return to content, Footnote 1

      2. Transactions at Non-U.S. Bank ATMs may be assessed ATM Transaction fees. Please refer to the Consumer Pricing Information disclosure. Additionally, Non-U.S. Bank ATM owners may apply a surcharge fee unless they participate in the MoneyPass® Network. To find MoneyPass ATM locations, select “Show MoneyPass® ATM Network locations” in the ATM locator.

        Return to content, Footnote 2

      3. If you have linked eligible accounts, and the negative Available Balance in your checking account is $5.01 or more, the advance amount will transfer in multiples of $50.00. If, however, the negative Available Balance is $5.00 or less, the amount advanced will be $5.00 and the Overdraft Protection Transfer Fee will be waived. Refer to the Your Deposit Account Agreement, section titled “Overdraft Protection Plans,” for additional information.

        Return to content, Footnote 3

      4. Eligibility requirements and restrictions apply. Please refer to the Digital Services Agreement for more information.

        Return to content, Footnote 4

      5. Additional checking accounts – Platinum and Gold Checking Package customers can open additional Easy Checking accounts with no monthly maintenance fee. Requires at least one identical account holder on all accounts. Gold Checking Package customers are limited to two Easy Checking accounts with no monthly maintenance fee. Loan approval is subject to credit approval and program guidelines.  Not all loan programs are available in all states for all loan amounts.  Interest rates and program terms are subject to change without notice.  Visit usbank.com to learn more about U.S. Bank products and services.

        Return to content, Footnote 5

      6. Package Money Market eligibility - A U.S. Bank Package Money Market Savings account requires you to maintain an open U.S. Bank Silver or Gold Checking Package account with at least one common account holder on each account. The Package Money Market Savings account will be converted to a U.S. Bank Standard Savings account if the Silver or Gold Checking Package account is closed or transferred to a different non-qualifying product. NOTE: As of February 11, 2019, the Silver Checking Package will no longer be offered.

        Return to content, Footnote 6

      7. For purchase or refinance transactions, the maximum credit is $1,000. Certain mortgages may not be eligible for stated credits. Offer may not be combined with any other mortgage offers and can only be applied once per property within a 12-month period.

        Return to content, Footnote 7

      8. To receive the U.S. Bank Customer Credit, a U.S. Bank Personal Checking Package must be established prior to final loan approval or, must have an existing first mortgage with U.S. Bank. A minimum of $25 is required to open a U.S. Bank Personal Checking Package. For a comprehensive list of account pricing, terms and policies see the Consumer Pricing Information brochure and the Your Deposit Account Agreement. These documents can be obtained by contacting a U.S. Bank branch or calling 800-872-2657. Loan approval is subject to credit approval and program guidelines. Not all loan programs are available in all states for all loan amounts. Interest rates and program terms are subject to change without notice. Visit usbank.com to learn more about U.S. Bank products and services.

        Return to content, Footnote 8

      9. Offer is for 100 free trades per calendar year (Jan. 1-Dec. 31). Free trades made available up to four business days from confirmation of account funding. This offer is not designed to support day trading or active trading and may be revoked if there is excessive or unreasonable activity. Additional fees may apply. Please refer to the Schedule of Commissions and Fees for more information at https://www.usbank.com/investing/online-investing/self-directed-investing/brokerage-fees.html.

        Return to content, Footnote 9

      • First-time home buyer guide

      First-time homebuyer guide and resources

      Home-buying made easy

      Dig into articles, tools and resources designed for each step of your home-buying journey.

      Preparing to buy

      Learn more

      The mortgage process

      Learn more

      Closing on your house

      Learn more

      Featured articles

      Preparing to buy

      How much house can I afford?

      A standard rule for lenders is that your monthly housing payment should not take up more than 28 percent of your income. However, home affordability is about more than just how much you can borrow.

      Read more

      The mortgage process

      Mortgage pre-approval vs. prequalification – what’s the difference?

      Prequalification and pre-approval can boost your confidence and could make house hunting easier – but it’s important to understand the difference between prequalification and pre-approval, and when to do which.

      Read more

      Closing on your house

      How much are closing costs?

      Closing is the last step in the home-buying process. Closing happens in a meeting between a combination of the buyer, the buyer’s agent, the seller, the seller’s agent and a closing agent.

      Read more

      Prequalification helps you see how much you might be able to borrow.

      Prequalify

      Common FAQs for first-time home buyers

      You could qualify for first-time homebuyer benefits even if you’ve owned a home before. There are several programs and benefits that could include low down payment options, down payment assistance, but your credit score is definitely one factor that lenders consider. You could qualify for a U.S. Bank local or state grants and more.

      To qualify for mortgage loans that are best suited for first-time homebuyers, there are general requirements that can include,

      • Down payment amount
      • Household income limitations
      • Credit score

      Our mortgage loan officers can work with you to see if you qualify for any first-time homebuyer programs.

      Depending on your home-ownership goals, we have a lot of great mortgage loan options for first-time buyers. Just to name a few, conventional loans can be ideal if you've been saving for a while and have a strong credit score. FHA loans can help if you're looking for a lower down payment option. Our mortgage loan officers can also help you determine which mortgage loan would work best for you.

      Depending on how much you can afford, your down payment could make a big impact on your monthly mortgage payments. Currently the U.S. Bank average down payment is about 11% for a first-time homebuyer. We offer several products that allow an even lower down payment percentage, though you could avoid certain fees associated with mortgages, and lower your monthly payment, by maximizing your down payment. A 20% down payment typically eliminates the addition of private mortgage insurance, or PMI.

      You don’t need perfect credit to qualify for a mortgage loan, but your credit score is definitely one factor that lenders consider. You could qualify for a U.S. Bank mortgage loan with a credit score as low as 620, but monitoring your credit activity will be important as you prepare to buy a home. The higher your score, the better.

example.content: Account must be open and in good standing to earn and redeem rewards and benefits. Upon approval, please refer to your Rewards Program Rules for additional information.
example.title: Account must be open

example.content: One-time 50,000 bonus Points will be awarded if you are approved for a new U.S. Bank Altitude Connect Visa Signature Card and eligible Net Purchases totaling $3,000 or more are made to your Account within 120 days after Account opening. Points are earned on eligible Net Purchases. Net Purchases are purchases minus credits and returns. Not all transactions are eligible to earn rewards, such as Advances, Balance Transfers, and Convenience Checks; upon approval, see your Cardmember Agreement for details. Please allow 6-8 weeks for your bonus Points to be credited to your Account. The bonus is not available to Cardmembers who currently have, or had, a U.S. Bank Altitude Connect Visa Signature account. Use of the Card is subject to terms and conditions of the U.S. Bank Altitude Connect Visa Signature Cardmember Agreement, which is provided at Account opening and may be amended from time to time. This offer may not be combined with any other bonus offer.
example.title: Altitude Connect 50k Bonus Points

example.content: Cash back is redeemed in the form of a statement credit or a deposit made to your U.S. Bank savings or checking account (2,500 Points minimum redemption).
example.title: Altitude Go - cash back is redeemed

example.content: Rewards are earned on eligible Net Purchases. Net Purchases are Purchases minus credits and returns. Not all transactions are eligible for rewards, such as Advances, Balance Transfers and Convenience Checks. Upon approval, please refer to the materials received with your new card and the Program Rules in the online Rewards Center by logging in to usbank.com for additional information. Account must be open and current (that is, no Minimum Payment is past due) on the closing date of the billing cycle in order to earn and redeem Points. Merchants identify their business by selecting a merchant category code established by Visa. A Purchase will not earn additional Points if the merchant’s selected code is in a category that is not eligible for additional Points earning. U.S. Bank does not determine the category codes that merchants choose and reserves the right to determine which Purchases qualify for additional Points. We reserve the right to adjust the number of Points for Purchases or to stop issuing Points for Purchases on the Account, upon notice to you. Use of the Card is subject to terms and conditions of the U.S. Bank Altitude Connect Visa Signature Cardmember Agreement, which may be amended from time to time. U.S. Bank Altitude Connect Visa Signature Cardmembers will earn one (1) Point for every $1 in eligible Net Purchases. In addition, you will earn additional Points for the following Net Purchases: You will earn four (4) additional bonus Points for every $1 in eligible Net Purchases spent on prepaid car and hotel reservations purchased in the online Altitude Rewards Center using your U.S. Bank Altitude Connect Card. Prepaid car and hotel reservations in the Rewards Center are not classified as a travel category merchant transaction and are not eligible to receive the additional points for that category. Please allow 1-2 statement billing cycles for your bonus Points to appear on your credit card statement. Refer to the Rewards Center for full details. You will earn three (3) additional Points for every $1 in eligible Net Purchases during each billing cycle for purchases made directly with merchants that are classified as a travel category transaction (such as purchases made directly with airlines, hotels, car rentals, taxicabs, limousines, passenger trains and cruise line companies) and for purchases made with merchants classified as a gas station. You will earn one (1) additional Point for every $1 in eligible Net Purchases during each billing cycle for any merchant classified as a restaurant, fast-food restaurant, bar, grocery store, supermarket or qualifying streaming subscription service. Refer to Program Rules for official list of qualifying streaming services merchants. Purchases at or delivery from discount/retail stores that sell groceries may not qualify for the grocery store or grocery delivery category.
example.title: Altitude Connect Rewards

example.content: An automatic statement credit of $30 per 12-month period will be applied to your U.S. Bank Altitude Connect Visa Signature Card Account within 2 statement billing cycles following 11 consecutive calendar months of eligible streaming service purchases, such as Netflix, Hulu, Apple Music, if the Account is in good standing (open and able to use). Refer to Program Rules for official list of qualifying streaming services merchants. We reserve the right to adjust or reverse any portion or all of any streaming services credit for unauthorized purchases or transaction credits.
example.title: Altitude Connect $30 Statement Credit

      Comprehensive suite of wealth management services

      You get end-to-end wealth management services with U.S. Bank and U.S. Bancorp Investments. Discover how we can help you work toward your wealth goals.

      • Wealth planning

        Bring clarity to your financial life and gain the confidence to achieve what you want. Learn how U.S. Bancorp Investments and U.S. Bank can help.

      Investing

       

      • Automated Investor

        Get personalized guidance from our smart robo-advisor, Automated Investor, an investment advisory product from U.S. Bancorp Investments. We’ll automatically invest, monitor and rebalance your account for you. Plus, you can talk to an investment professional whenever you have questions.

      • Brokerage accounts

        A self-directed brokerage account from U.S. Bancorp Investments gives you the control to manage your portfolio the way you want.

      • IRAs

        It's easy for you to open and fund an Individual Retirement Account (IRA) through U.S. Bank or U.S. Bancorp Investments. Whether you prefer investing on your own or want personal investment guidance, we have an option to fit your needs.

      • Investment management

        How will you weather market unpredictability while keeping an eye on long term growth? The U.S. Bank Asset Management Group relies on data, disciplined processes, historical insights and current market dynamics to create investment strategies for all types of investors.

      Additional services

       

      • Banking

        Manage your money conveniently with customized banking products and services from U.S. Bank.

      • Trust and estates

        Support the people and causes you care about for generations to come with our U.S. Bank Trust and Estate services.

      Specialty services

       

      • Business planning

        As you grow your business, Business Owner Advisory Services from U.S. Bank Wealth Management can be your strategic partner to help it thrive.

      • Charitable giving

        Maximize the impact of your charitable giving to support the causes that are most important with giving strategies from U.S. Bank Wealth Management.

      • Insurance

        Protect what matters with life, disability, and long-term care insurance through U.S. Bancorp Investments’ personalized insurance strategies.

      • Specialty asset management

        Get expert guidance from the Specialty Asset Management Group at U.S. Bank on nonfinancial assets such as real estate, farms, ranches, natural resources and closely held assets.

      Our Service Teams

      We work to understand your assets, needs and goals, then provide the right level of support to help you move forward.
